newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on commercial, fund selling.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on commercial, fund selling.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended lower on commercial and fund selling and on a slide in nearby CBOT soybeans, traders said.

"It's a nervous market ahead of Monday's USDA report," a trader said in reference to the USDA's next crop production estimates. Funds sold 300 July. July WCE futures canola crush profit margin ended at -3.08. Locals sold 300 July-Nov at $39 to commercials, July-Aug spread at $1, May-July $1. Volume was 4,695 lots, or 93,900 tonnes, with 214 hedge lots.
July canola lost $2.50 to $426.20 and November fell $2.30 to end at 387.40. July flax lost $0.50 to $332.20, November rose $1.50 to $320.50 on commercial demand. Volume was 195 lots, 61 hedges.

May western barley slipped $2.30 to $135.50. July fell $1 to $137.10 and December rose $0.80 to $139.50 at the close on commercial demand. May-July spread at $1.50 with Oct-Dec at even money. Volume was 1,150 lots.
Oats and feed peas did not trade.
May feed wheat fell $2.20 to $161, October lost $0.20 to $165. May-July spread at $1. Volume was 927 lots.
"Commercials are liquidating nearbys," a feed grain trader said.
"The cash looks weak and there's little support from Eastern Canada (feedlots)," the trader added.
(All prices in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats, peas).
